name: Adam (A.S.)
bio: Adam (A.S.) was the first human being, created by Allah from clay. He lived in the Garden of Jannah with his wife, Hawwa (Eve), before being sent to Earth as the first Prophet and custodian of the planet.
events: Creation from clay and the prostration of the angels.
Temptation by Iblis (Satan) and eating from the forbidden tree.
Sincere repentance to Allah and being sent to Earth.
lessons: The nature of repentance, the importance of forgiveness, and humanity's role as stewards (Khalifa) of the Earth.

name: Nuh (Noah) - A.S.
bio: Nuh (A.S.) was a Prophet sent to his people after they had fallen into idolatry. He preached the message of Tawhid (the Oneness of Allah) for 950 years with patience, but only a few believed.
events: Preaching the message of Tawhid for 950 years.
Building the great Ark under Allah’s command.
The Great Flood that saved the believers and cleansed the Earth.
lessons: Unwavering patience and absolute trust in Allah’s plan.

name: Ibrahim (Abraham) - A.S.
bio: Ibrahim (A.S.) is known as Khalil-ullah (the Friend of Allah). He stood against idolatry, debated his people and the tyrant king, and showed complete submission to Allah.
events: Destroying the idols of his people.
Being thrown into the fire which Allah made cool and safe.
Willingness to sacrifice his son Ismail (A.S.) as a test of faith.
Rebuilding the Kaaba in Makkah with his son Ismail (A.S.).
lessons: The meaning of true submission, courage, and the legacy of Tawhid.

name: Musa (Moses) - A.S.
bio: Musa (A.S.) was sent to free the Children of Israel from Pharaoh’s tyranny. He performed miracles by Allah’s permission and was given the Torah.
events: Confrontation with Pharaoh and his magicians.
The nine great signs (miracles) sent to Pharaoh.
Parting of the Red Sea.
Receiving the Torah on Mount Tur.
lessons: Courage in the face of tyranny and the importance of divine guidance.

name: Isa (Jesus) - A.S.
bio: Isa (A.S.), the son of Maryam, was born miraculously and sent to guide the Children of Israel. He performed miracles by Allah’s will and will return before the Day of Judgment.
events: Miraculous birth and speaking from the cradle.
Healing the sick and reviving the dead.
Being raised to Allah, not crucified.
His return before the Day of Judgment.
lessons: Faith in Allah’s power and the virtue of purity.

name: Hud - A.S.
bio: Hud (A.S.) was sent to the people of Aad, a proud and powerful nation. He called them to worship Allah alone and warned them of punishment for their arrogance.
events: Calling the people of Aad to Tawhid.
Their rejection and arrogance.
The fierce wind that destroyed them.
lessons: The danger of arrogance and rejecting truth.

name: Salih - A.S.
bio: Salih (A.S.) was sent to the people of Thamud. He called them to worship Allah alone, but they demanded a miracle — the she-camel — which they later killed.
events: Calling the people to Tawhid.
The miracle of the she-camel.
The destruction of Thamud after killing the camel.
lessons: Respect for Allah’s signs and messengers.

name: Yusuf (Joseph) - A.S.
bio: Yusuf (A.S.) was known for his beauty, patience, and wisdom. He was betrayed by his brothers, imprisoned unjustly, and later became a ruler in Egypt.
events: Thrown into a well by his brothers.
Imprisoned after false accusations.
Interpreting dreams and becoming a ruler.
Reuniting with his family in Egypt.
lessons: Patience, forgiveness, and reliance on Allah in hardship.

name: Dawud (David) - A.S.
bio: Dawud (A.S.) was a Prophet and King known for his wisdom, bravery, and beautiful recitation of the Zabur (Psalms).
events: Defeating Jalut (Goliath).
Being made King of Israel.
Receiving the Zabur.
lessons: Justice, humility, and gratitude to Allah.

name: Muhammad (ﷺ)
bio: Muhammad (ﷺ) is the final Messenger of Allah, sent to all humanity with the message of Islam. He brought the Qur’an, the final revelation.
events: Receiving the first revelation in the cave of Hira.
The Night Journey and Ascension (Mi'raj).
The Hijrah to Madinah.
The Farewell Pilgrimage and completion of the message.
lessons: Mercy, compassion, and perfect character for all mankind.
